instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
no water damage
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> go to 5v, then drops to 0and get back to 5, it cycling 
ppbus = 12.65
what to try next ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing at same time?

Remove <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing  also
i removed  <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR>  no effect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
Check if other big coils pulse too.
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> pulsing too?

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
I checked Resistance between 17/18 it gave me 2.5 ohm, and between 27/28 20.5 ohm
and yes <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> pulsing too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
"Try to start in SMC bypass mode."
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
Any pulse at L7260?
Check for short on all big coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message: Yes indeed L7260 Pulsing and it's shorted

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message:
Shorted if pulsing???
Post the exact ohm resistance to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> drops
threads.message: It was totally shorted, resistance reading was 0 ohm, i enjected voltage and i found <CAPACITOR>C6213</CAPACITOR> broken, i changed it and now working.
